Description: Glazed composition minute jar (maybe measuring-vessel); with drop-shaped body, hollow interior, and one perforated neatly shaped lug-handle at rim, no separate lip. Glaze gone, core fine, hard, buff colour.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Egypt Exploration Fund (Committe of)
Curator's comments: For another example from Naukratis but in copper alloy, see: BM 1885,1101.114. Similar miniature jars are identified as measuring-vessel (Petrie 1926, 36f, Pl. 23). Tanja Pommerening dates them tentatively of the New Kingdom (Pommerening 2005, 372-373, 382), but they could be much later. Petrie, W. M. F. 1926, Ancient Weights and Measures Illustrated by the Egyptian Collection in University College, London. Pommerening, T. 2005, Die altägyptischen Hohlmasse, Studien zur altägyptischen Kultur. B. 10.
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 19, pl. XIX, no. 3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (FD.07)
